jsondiscoverer.web

Class AbstractJsonDiscoverer

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • jsondiscoverer.web.AbstractJsonDiscoverer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonAdvancedDiscovererServlet, JsonComposerServlet, JsonInjectorServlet, JsonSimpleDiscovererServlet, ProxyServlet, StatusServlet, VersionServlet

    public abstract class AbstractJsonDiscoverer
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    Abstract class to factor some common behavior among the JSON discoverers.

    In particular, this class helps to:

    • Draw models. Generates a picture (stored in a file) which is the renderization of a list of EObjects (see drawModel(List, String) and drawModel(List, String, GVFigureDescription)
    • Encode files to String. Generates the Base64 representation of files (see encodeToString(File), encodeToString(EPackage, String) and encodeToString(List, String)
    Author:
    Javier Canovas (me@jlcanovas.es)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
          throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Initilizes the servlet class. THis implementation is used in any JSON discoverer servlet.

        It performs the following steps:

        • Registers the ecore and xmi extensions in EMF to enable the model management
        • Reads the properties file (called config.properties and located at WEB-INF folder)
        Overrides:
        init in class javax.servlet.GenericServlet
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        See Also:
        GenericServlet.init()

      • encodeToString

        java.lang.String encodeToString(java.io.File path)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Encodes a file into BASE64 format.

        In the context of the tool, this method is used to encode generated pictures (usually with @link drawModel(List, String)) into BASE64 format, which is easy to exchange with the web client.

        Parameters:
        path - The path to the file to encode
        Returns:
        A String in BASE64
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • encodeToString

        java.lang.String encodeToString(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage ePackage,
                                java.lang.String uniqueId)
                         throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Saves the EPackage into a XMI and then read it to return it as String in Base64.

        The workflow followed is:

        • Creates a temp file where the metamodel (as EPackage) will be stored
        • Saves the metamodel in the temp file
        • Reads the file and encodes it as base64
        • Returns the String encoded as Base64

        Metamodels are saved in a directory that is configred by providing a value to the corresponding property in the config.properties file. The key to retrieve the property is provided in the para uniqueId.

        Parameters:
        ePackage - The metamodel (as EPackage
        uniqueId - The key to retrieve the property in the config.properties file setting the folder where the metamodel will be saved
        Returns:
        A String encoded in Base64 representing the metamodel
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - Something went wrong (usually IO-related problem)

      • encodeToString

        java.lang.String encodeToString(java.util.List<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> elements,
                                java.lang.String uniqueId)
                         throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Saves a list of EObjects into a XMI and then read it to return it as String in Base64. Similar to encodeToString(EPackage, String)

        The workflow followed is:

        • Creates a temp file where the list of EObjects will be stored
        • Saves the list of EObjects in the temp file
        • Reads the file and encodes it as base64
        • Returns the String encoded as Base64

        The list of EObjects are saved in a directory that is configred by providing a value to the corresponding property in the config.properties file. The key to retrieve the property is provided in the para uniqueId.

        Parameters:
        elements - The list of EObjects
        uniqueId - The key to retrieve the property in the config.properties file setting the folder where the list of EObjects will be saved
        Returns:
        A String encoded in Base64 representing the list of EObjects
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - Something went wrong (usually IO-related problem)

      • drawModel

        java.io.File drawModel(java.util.List<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> elements,
                       java.lang.String uniqueId,
                       org.emftools.emf2gv.graphdesc.GVFigureDescription graphDesc)
                throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Draws a model into a picture, stored a file.

        The process follows these steps:

        • First the name of the folder is retrieved from the properties file
        • A temp file is created
        • Then the model is rendered into a picture and stored in the temp file

        Files are stored in a folder configured in the config properties file. The name of the property is set by the uniqueId param.

        The generation of the picture is delegated to the method StandaloneProcessor.process(EObject, GVFigureDescription, File, String, org.emftools.emf2gv.processor.core.IProcessorCallback, org.emftools.emf2gv.processor.core.IEObjectIconProvider, String, boolean, boolean, String, List, org.emftools.emf2gv.processor.core.ILogger, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor)

        A graphical style has to be provided. See the documentation of EMF2GV to know how to create it.

        Parameters:
        elements - List of elements (as EObjects) to be drawn
        uniqueId - Id used to retrieve the folder name from the config properties file to store the file
        graphDesc - Graphical description according to EMF2GV format
        Returns:
        The picture file
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - If any problem appears (usually IO-related problems)

      • drawModel

        java.io.File drawModel(java.util.List<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> elements,
                       java.lang.String uniqueId)
                throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Draws a model into a picture following the standard graphical style.

        This method relies on drawModel(List, String, GVFigureDescription)

        Default graphical style will be used. The style is provided by EMF2GV library, please refer to its documentation for further details.

        Parameters:
        elements - List of elements (as EObjects) to be drawn
        uniqueId - Id used to retrieve the folder name from the config properties file to store the file
        Returns:
        The picture file
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - If any problem appears (usually IO-related problems)

      • drawObjectModel

        java.io.File drawObjectModel(java.util.List<org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> elements,
                             org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage ePackage,
                             java.lang.String uniqueId)
                      throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Draws a model into a picture with a UML-like graphical style.

        This method relies on drawModel(List, String, GVFigureDescription)

        Parameters:
        elements - List of elements (as EObjects) to be drawn
        uniqueId - Id used to retrieve the folder name from the config properties file to store the file
        Returns:
        The picture file
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - If any problem appears (usually IO-related problems)

      • addResponseOptions

        protected void addResponseOptions(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Generic method to aoid CORS problems.

        Adds the CORS headers related to access-control-allow settings

        The value for the header Access-Control-Allow-Origin is parameterized with the value given in the config.properties with the key serverURL

        Parameters:
        response - The response where the headers will be added
